comments:
Build: I20050315-1100

I got into a state where I couldn't reuse the current editor.  Hitting F3 to go
into another type would cause a NullPointerException.  After closing all editors
I was no longer able to reproduce.

Created an attachment (id=18810)
Log file

I noticed some PartInitExceptions in my log as well.  These could be related so
here is my entire log file.
Any ideas on how to reproduce?

Created an attachment (id=18842)
Preference export file

My preferences, in case they are relevant.  Note I have it set to automatically
reuse editors.

I can't consistently reproduce, but it happened quite a few times yesterday
while just browsing through code... opening types with Ctrl+Shift+T and doing
alot of F3 jumps to other files.

This may help: it just happened again, and this time it occurred in an editor
that had been opened implicitly as a result of a breakpoint being hit.  Once in
this state, all open editors are broken and need to be closed (doing F3 results
in the NPE)
Does this happen in previous builds?

It only started happening in I20050315-1100.  Never saw it before that. Of
course I was away much of last week and didn't use the previous integration
build very much.
*** Bug 88231 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 88245 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 88326 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 88857 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This error happens quite frequently for me, but it always seems to happen after
an editor has been opened automatically by the debugger.  It might be useful to
know if other people seing this bug have the same experience.  Upping severity
since once in this state you must close all open editors to get back into a
state where new editors can be opened.
I only saw the .log entries and experienced no problems in the UI.
*** Bug 88882 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I am seeing this too.  Basically opening editors on the same file in some cases
from various places Search, Open Type, or double click from package explorer.

I think it is related to the "Close Editors Automatically" option.  If I turn
this off everything works.

When it is on and I tried to load the nth editor where n is equal to the number
of editors I allow there to be open it fails.  (not n+1 .. wierd)

John is this the case for you?
Kim could this be related to content type changes?

No...this bug predates those changes.  The content type stuff went in over the
weekend.

Also, I don't use the Close Editors Automatically option and I too have seen this...

In my case it's not as simple as opening n or n+1 editors.  I can open editors
all day without the problem happening - it only seems to happen when I'm
debugging.  I'm trying to get a consistent test case to reproduce it.

Here is my stack trace.  The line numbers appear different.

/michae;

--------------------

Michael, in which build did you get these line numbers? Was the NPE preceeded by
any assertation failures?

Checking the code in head, this appears to be due to the page pointer rather
than the window. However, there is only one write access to the page pointer,
and that is protected by an Assert.isNotNull.

Version: 3.1.0
Build id: I20050323-0842
*** Bug 90278 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I was barking up the wrong tree. Here's the problematic line of code:

if ((desc.getId().equals(oldDesc.getId()))

To reproduce,

1. Enable the reuse-editors preference
2. Follow the steps to reproduce bug 89246.
3. Open a new editor

Generates this stack trace. The recursion in bug 89246 is causing parts to be
created with a null descriptor on their site.
